pr_title: Rewrite opt for combining consecutive byte loads

timeline.message:
Rewrite opt for combining consecutive byte loads

Changes were made inside the sequentialStoreSimplification. Despite the name
of the optimization, the changes are targeted at sequential loads.

Rewrote the optimization that identifies byte loads from conseuctive memory
addresses and replaces them with a wider load such as an iload or lload. The
new version greatly expands the number of tree patterns indentified by the
optimization. The new wide load optimization works with 2-8 consecutive byte
loads and in both big and little endian order.

The original version of the opt is still available under the env var
TR_UseOldSeqLoadOpt.

Moved sequentialStoreSimplificationGroup later in the optimization order so
that the trees are more likely to be in the right shape for the optimization.

Moved sequentialStoreSimplification out of Optimizations.enum to OMR where it
is used for the tracing option.

Closes: #11250
Signed-off-by: jimmyk <jimmyk@ca.ibm.com>

Rewrite opt for combining consecutive byte loads

Changes were made inside the sequentialStoreSimplification. Despite the name
of the optimization, the changes are targeted at sequential loads.

Rewrote the optimization that identifies byte loads from conseuctive memory
addresses and replaces them with a wider load such as an iload or lload. The
new version greatly expands the number of tree patterns indentified by the
optimization. The new wide load optimization works with 2-8 consecutive byte
loads and in both big and little endian order.

The original version of the opt is still available under the env var
TR_UseOldSeqLoadOpt.

Moved sequentialStoreSimplificationGroup later in the optimization order so
that the trees are more likely to be in the right shape for the optimization.

Moved sequentialStoreSimplification out of Optimizations.enum to OMR where it
is used for the tracing option.

Closes: #11250
Signed-off-by: jimmyk <jimmyk@ca.ibm.com>

Changed handling of multValue

Changed getMultValueForSeqLoad to getShiftValueForSeqLoad.

Loop that looks for duplicate multValues and orders the loaded bytes is no
longer a loop and is now based on shiftValue.

Added more comments.
Cleaned up the code.

timeline.bodyText:
Does this need to be in its own directory? Do we envision adding more files here? If not we should move it out.
Great set of tests by the way! Readers take note.
timeline.author: fjeremic
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,935 @@
+/*******************************************************************************
+ * Copyright (c) 2020, 2020 IBM Corp. and others
+ *

+ * the terms of the Eclipse Public License 2.0 which accompanies this
+ * distribution and is available at https://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-2.0/
+ * or the Apache License, Version 2.0 which accompanies this distribution and
+ * is available at https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.
+ *
+ * This Source Code may also be made available under the following
+ * Secondary Licenses when the conditions for such availability set
+ * forth in the Eclipse Public License, v. 2.0 are satisfied: GNU
+ * General Public License, version 2 with the GNU Classpath
+ * Exception [1] and GNU General Public License, version 2 with the
+ * OpenJDK Assembly Exception [2].
+ *
+ * [1] https://www.gnu.org/software/classpath/license.html
+ * [2] http://openjdk.java.net/legal/assembly-exception.html
+ *
+ * SPDX-License-Identifier: EPL-2.0 OR Apache-2.0 OR GPL-2.0 WITH Classpath-exception-2.0 OR LicenseRef-GPL-2.0 WITH Assembly-exception
+ *******************************************************************************/
+package jit.test.tr.SeqLoadSimplification;

replies.bodyText:
Thanks.
I don't expect to add more files here. However, I don't really see a better place to put it. I tried looking at other tests to see how they organize their files but a lot of them are single files in a directory as well.
replies.author: IBMJimmyk

replies.bodyText: Can we simply move SeqLoadSimplificationTest.java into test/functional/JIT_Test/src/jit/test/tr/?
replies.author: fjeremic

replies.bodyText: Yes, that's possible. In my latest changed I've now moved it out.
replies.author: IBMJimmyk

Rewrite opt for combining consecutive byte loads

Changes were made inside the sequentialStoreSimplification. Despite the name

Rewrote the optimization that identifies byte loads from conseuctive memory
